about.occupation: Computer Science student at Boston College
about.header: I'm a passionate computer science student with a strong interest in the world of software development.
about.quip1: As a lifelong learner and technology enthusiast, I'm always on the lookout for exciting opportunities to apply my skills and knowledge to real-world challenges.
about.quip2: Over the years, I've honed my programming skills in languages like Python, Javascript, HTML, and CSS, and web frameworks such as Django and React. I'm constantly exploring new technologies and languages in order to create applications with real-world uses, and love seeing the ways that emerging technology can empower our lives.

news.description: Graduated from Brownsburg High School in Brownsburg, Indiana.
Began attending Boston College, majoring in Computer Science.
Started working at Boston College Makerspace.
Participated in HackTheHeights8 Hackathon, and won 'Best Overall' and 'Best Use of Auth0'.

skills.name: Frontend Development
skills.description: I am familiar with HTML, CSS, Javascript, and Bootstrap, and I'm constantly trying to learn as much as I can about frontend web development.

skills.name: Backend Development
skills.description: I am learning and constantly improving at Django and React, in order to develop and maintain usable, fast, and secure backend for software applications.

skills.name: Graphic Design
skills.description: I have experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, and enjoy the intersection of design and functionality as it relates to web development.

projects.title: GradConnect
projects.problem: Problem: High School seniors often have no way to know what to expect for college applications and have no way to get firsthand accounts of what to expect at college.
projects.solution: Solution: A full-stack React social media web application that allows high school seniors to connect with college mentors to offer guidance.

projects.title: Canvas Automated Reminders
projects.problem: Problem: Canvas sends out automated email reminders daily for classes and assignments, but not until 6 PM, which is too late to be meaningful.
projects.solution: Solution: A custom automated emailing system that makes use of python and the CanvasAPI to send reminders everyday at 8 AM.

projects.title: Automated BC Health Check
projects.problem: Problem: Boston College required a daily questionnaire to use facilities that was time-consuming and easy to forget.
projects.solution: Solution: Using python and selenium, wrote a script that I ran each morning (assuming I was in good health), to automate the daily task.

projects.title: Terminal Wordle
projects.problem: Problem: The popular game Wordle requires an internet connection AND a browser to play.
projects.solution: Solution: Using Java, get game information in the form of a csv file and create a version of Wordle that is played (in color) in the terminal.
